parameters.name: Propagate
parameters.description: True propagates the swept protrusion to the next tangent edge, false does not

parameters.name: Alignment
parameters.description: True causes the swept protrusion to go through the end faces if the curve used for the sweep goes from one face to another or from one edge to another, false causes the swept protrusion to begin and end perpendicular to the sweep curve; thus, it cannot break through the two end faces of the body

parameters.name: TwistCtrlOption
parameters.description: Twist control options as defined in swTwistControlType_e

parameters.name: KeepTangency
parameters.description: If the sweep section has tangent segments, then true to cause the corresponding surfaces in the resulting sweep to be tangent, false to not

parameters.name: BAdvancedSmoothing
parameters.description: If the sweep section has circular or elliptical arcs, then true to approximate the sections and smooth the surfaces, false to not

parameters.name: StartMatchingType
parameters.description: Tangency type as defined in swTangencyType_e

parameters.name: EndMatchingType
parameters.description: Tangency type as defined in swTangencyType_e

parameters.name: IsThinBody
parameters.description: True if this feature is a thin body, false if not

parameters.name: Thickness1
parameters.description: Thickness value for the first direction

parameters.name: Thickness2
parameters.description: Thickness value for the second direction

parameters.name: ThinType
parameters.description: Thin wall type as defined in swThinWallType_e

parameters.name: PathAlign
parameters.description: Align path type (see Remarks )

parameters.name: Merge
parameters.description: True to merge the results in a multibody part, false to not

parameters.name: UseFeatScope
parameters.description: True if the feature only affects selected bodies, false if the feature affects all bodies

parameters.name: UseAutoSelect
parameters.description: True to automatically select all bodies and have the feature affect those bodies, false to select the bodies the feature affects (see Remarks )

parameters.name: TwistAngle
parameters.description: If TwistCtrlOption is swTwistControlType_e.swTwistControlConstantTwistAlongPath, then specify end twist angle

parameters.name: BMergeSmoothFaces
parameters.description: True to merge smooth faces, false to not

parameters.name: CircularProfile
parameters.description: True to use a circular profile, false to use the selected sketch profile or solid body

parameters.name: CircularProfileDiameter
parameters.description: If CircularProfile is true, then specify the diameter of the circular profile

parameters.name: Direction
parameters.description: Direction as defined in swSweepDirection_e (see Remarks )

remarks:
SOLIDWORKS 2018 introduces a new sweep architecture, making this method obsolete. See
Sweep Features and SweepFeatureData Objects
to create this swept-boss or base feature.
Use
IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2
to select the sketch profile and sweep curves. Specify these marks:
1 = Sketch profile
2 = Guide curve, if provided
4 = Sweep path
The PathAlign argument is available when TwistCtrlOption is set to swTwistControlType_e.swTwistControlFollowPath and can take one of these values:
0 = None; no correction (default)
2 = Direction vector; a plane, planar face, or line defines the path
3 = All faces; includes neighboring faces
When UseAutoSelect is false, the user must select the bodies that the feature will affect.
Direction only applies to sketch profiles and only when the sketch profile is not coincident with an end of the path.
